g.text: 1. Able to get current location weather
2. Able to find other location weather
Per day: 1000 * 60 ( per min ) * 60 ( per hour ) * 24 ( per day ) = 10^3 * 86400
The request above is very huge. around 365B request per 10 year, and 36M req per year.
Keep in mind that we are using OpenWeatherAPI, it's third party
1. The user will hit LB with the lat long they query
2. The LB will spread the load to each services
3. The services will call redis, if it's not there call the cassandra
4. The cassandra will check again, if there is a value there
5. If it's not, it will goes to opernweathermap api ( 3rd party )
6. Openweather map will return result, save to cassandra for permanent store
7. Cassandra will return back to redis logic, and save the value on redis as well for that specific location query
By using these logics, we can assume that request to the third party will be lesser, because of we're using Redis and Cassandra as storage for equivalent query in the future.
